clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Quetiapine on Negative Symptoms and Cognition
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Quetiapine Compared to Risperidone on Negative Symptoms and Cognition With Regard to Underlying Neurobiological Mechanisms and Brain Activation.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to investigate the outcome on negative symptoms of schizophrenic patients during therapy with quetiapine or risperidone.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical efficacy of both neuroleptics, especially with regard to cognitive deficits and functional brain activation between baseline and week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in PANSS negative symptom total score, PANSS subscores, CGI, CGI-severity of illness, HAMD, Simpson-Angus-Scale, BPRS, specific PANSS items , Startle reflex.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed informed consent
- men and women aged 18 to 65 years with diagnosis of schizophrenia
- score of at least 4 CGI, PANSS negative subscale score > 21
- fulfil the criterion to be right-handed for inclusion in the fMRI investigations
Exclusion Criteria:
- Substance or alcohol dependence
- female patients who are pregnant, lactating or at risk of pregnancy
- history of organic CNS-trauma, epilepsy, meningoencephalitis, psychosurgery, instable somatic conditions
- risk of suicide or aggressive behaviour
- history of electroconvulsive therapy, Parkinson's disease, Prolactin-dependent tumor
For the subset of subjects for the fMRI investigations the following additional exclusion criteria is valid as:
- existence of metal in the body as by cardiac pacemaker, coil, total prosthesis, metal splinter, metal articulation, metal balls.
